article.headline: Hereâs whatâs coming to Amazon Prime Video in October 2020
article.body: From kid-friendly specials to bloody horror, Amazon Prime Video is gearing up for Halloween with a slate of new releases in October. And Borat! Horror fans can look forward to âWelcome to the Blumhouse,â an anthology series of creepy genre movies that will drop a pair of double features in October: âBlack Boxâ and âThe Lieâ (Oct. 6), and âEvil Eyeâ and âNocturneâ (Oct. 13). Expect tales of murder, deception and (bwahahaha) madness. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } If thatâs a little too intense, thereâs also âTruth Seekersâ (Oct. 30), an eight-episode comedy series from Simon Pegg and Nick Frost (âShaun of the Deadâ) about paranormal investigators, and âBug Diaries Halloween Specialâ (Oct. 2), an animated kids show about friendly insects. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Prime also has a ton of older scary movies coming, including â30 Days of Night,â âJohn Carpenterâs Vampiresâ and âThe Grudge 3â (all Oct. 1). Among non-Halloween fare, Amazon.com Inc.âs US:AMZN Â streaming service will roll out âChasing the Crown: Dreamers to Streamersâ (Oct. 9), a competition series for Twitch videogame streamers; NFL football every Thursday starting Oct. 8; and fresh episodes of the ultraviolent superhero satire âThe Boysâ every Friday. Update: A surprise âBoratâ sequel will drop on Amazon on Oct. 23. This could be big â the first installment of Sasha Baron Cohenâs gonzo/reality comedy reaped more than $260 million at the box office in 2006. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } See: Whatâs coming in October to Netflix | Hulu Also read:âThe Mandalorianâ returns, but what other streaming picks are worth paying for in October 2020?
